At 07:50 AM 9/17/01, you wrote:
>My problem with the 4 tests approach is that if for some reason the public API
>for the tests change, I have to change n+1 test methods. Whereas if I contain
>everything in a single test (as I'm doing now) I only have to change it once
>when the public API changes (and yes, it has happened).

Shouldn't the 4 tests each be about 1/4 the size of the one big test?
subject: Re: [junit] Proper use of TestReult
